pull.title: test: add assertions to SRD max weight test
pull.body:
Replace generic assertion with a result specific assertion showing the correctness of the solution found.  If the max weight parameter is exceeded, the least valuable `UTXOs` are removed from the result. Therefore, only the most valued _encountered_ `UTXO's` are selected. While the smallest set would include all the most valued `UTXO's`, in the case of the test there is one high value `UTXO` that is never found before the target value is reached.

Correct the test comment to be more specific about why the assertion is a good result.

events.message:
test: add assertions to SRD max weight test

Replace generic assertion with a result specific assertion showing the
correctness of the solution found.  If the max weight parameter is
exceeded, the least valuable `UTXOs` are removed from the result.
Therefore, only the most valued _encountered_ `UTXO's` are selected.
While the smallest set would include all the most valued `UTXO's`, in
the case of the test there is one high value `UTXO` that is never found
before the target value is reached.

Improve the test comment to be more specific about why the assertion is
a good result.

events.body:
> [18:13:33.790] ./wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp(1247): ï¿½[1;31;49merror: in "coinselector_tests/srd_tests": check EquivalentResult(expected_result, *res) has failedï¿½[0;39;49m

That is the unit test, right?  It passes for me locally.  I just re-based and pushed again and now that job is passing.  I wonder now if there's a possible random seed that could cause SRD to fail.
Oh I see, SRD generates a different solution each time in the test-suit.  That's annoying.

Yeah, as you noted, Single Random Draw is non-deterministic, so you would only get a predictable input set if there is only exactly one composition permitted. I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s necessary to test what you want, though:

comments.body:
What SRD does is a bit different:

```suggestion
        // 3) Test that SRD result does not exceed the max weight
```
Is it not true that when the max weight is encountered, the least valuable utxo is removed from the selection via the min-heap?  Therefore the most valuable are returned?
